article_text:
President Barack Obama, left, shops with his daughters, Sasha, center, and Malia, at Politics and Prose bookstore for “Small Business Saturday,” in November. Photo: The Associated Press

Small business owners are feeling better about the direction of the economy.

That’s the conclusion drawn from a survey conducted by Bank of America of 1,001 small business owners with annual revenue between $100,000 and $5 million.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Jack Craver
article_metadata.description: Small business owners are feeling better about the direction of the economy.

og.title: Small business owners feeling optimistic

That’s the conclusion drawn from a survey conducted by Bank of America of 1,001 small business owners with annual revenue between $100,000 and $5 million.
President Barack Obama, left, shops with his daughters, Sasha, center, and Malia, at Politics and Prose bookstore for “Small Business Saturday,” in November.
